readability_reflection: I like concatenation a lot more since the plus signs just make it way more clear. Like I can clearly tell what part is being added compared to interpolation. Plus I am used to plus signs as opposed to brackets so I felt more comfortable reading those,
comprehension_debugging: Yes it was much harder readbility wise when there was a bunch of string concatenation and interpolation involved in a code snippet on top of literal strings. It was harder to see which one was which.
preference_rationale: Concatenation because I can tell what I am combining in the string with plus signs. It's quite readable too because interpolation makes me think I am extracting something not inputting a string, if that makes sense.
learning_curve: Like I said concatenation is much clearer for me since I am used to using plus signs as opposed to brackets for adding strings. It makes more sense in readability as well so personally, I prefer it.
